thread.title: Exmouth Green candidates warn against risk to water quality after Brexit | Devon Live
thread.title_full: Exmouth Green candidates warn against risk to water quality after Brexit | Devon Live

title: Exmouth Green candidates warn against risk to water quality after Brexit | Devon Live
text:
Exmouth Green candidates warn against risk to water quality after Brexit By DanielClark | Posted: March 22, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES Rob Masding, left, and Olly Davey, right, Green Party candidates for the Exmouth Division Exmouth Green candidates warn against risk to water quality after Brexit X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
Green party candidates in Exmouth are calling for 'Green guarantees' to make sure that environmental regulation remains at least as strong as current EU regulations when Brexit happens. 
Exmouth has a much loved beach, enjoyed for its clean water, soft golden sand that reflects the light, the open space and the extensive views. 
Rob Masding and Olly Davey, who will stand for election in May 2017 for Devon County Council, said: “The history of Exmouth is fundamentally linked to its glorious estuary location and its beaches, and our care of this environment is key to a successful tourist industry and a sustainable future for the town. It has to be acknowledged that, whether or not we voted to remain in or to leave the EU, it has been EU regulation that has forced us to clean up our coastlines; effecting change from a past where raw sewage was heedlessly pumped into our seas. 
“We would like to see 'Green guarantees' to make sure that environmental regulation remains at least as strong as current EU regulation and to ensure UK compliance with environmental regulation through an independent court. This approach is sensible both for our environment and for our town's core business."
